div.l: And light ful stylle and wold han caught a slep
With in a while this Iohn the clerk vp leep
And on this good wif he leith on sore
So mury a fit ne hadde she ful yoore
He priketh hard and depe as he were mad
This Ioly lif han thise two clerkes lad
Til that the thirdde kok by gan to synge
Aleyn wax wery in the dawenynge
For he hadde swonken al the longe nyght
And seide farwel Malyn my swete wight
The day is come I may no lenger byde
But eủere more were so y go or ryde
I is thyn awn clerk so haue y sel
Now deere lemman quod she farwel
But er thou go o thyng I wol the telle
Whan that thow wendest homward by the mylle
Right at the entre of the doore byhynde
Thow shalt a kake of half a busshel fynde
That was y maked of thyn owene mele
Which that y helpe my Sire for to stele
And good lemman god the saue and kepe
And with that word al moost she gan to wepe
Aleyn vprist and thoghte er that it dawe
Y wol go crepen In by my felawe
An fonde the cradel with his hand a non̄
By god thaughte he al wrang y haue mysgon̄
Myn hed is toty of my swynke to nyght
That maketh me that I go nat a right
I wot wel by the of of cradel y haue mysgo
Here light the myller͗e and his wif also
And forth he goth on twenty deuelway
Vn to the bed ther as the myller lay
He wend haue cropen by his felawe Iohn
And by the Millere In he creep a non
